DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Intervention Trial HIV-infected Injection Drug Users
DOC.detailed_description: INSPIRE four-site ( Baltimore , Miami , New York San Francisco ) randomize control trial develop evaluate efficacy ten-session intervention HIV-positive injection drug user . The primary goal intervention : 1. decrease sex injection risk behavior put others risk HIV infection , 2. increase access utilization HIV primary health care , 3. increase adherence HIV medication . The intervention arm consist 7 group session , 2 individual session , one community experience . The control arm consist 8 group session , aim control demand ( 1st session ) attention ( 8 group session ) . Behavioral assessment blood draw ( viral load CD4 test ) occur baseline , 6 , 12 month follow-up ; 3 month assessment involve behavioral assessment . 1161 participant take baseline . Of , 966 randomize study , 840 , 807 , 821 participant take 3 , 6 , 12 month follow-up assessment , respectively .
